title.narrative: Integrated Livestock Development Project for Western Rural District (ILDeP)

description.narrative: Placement of animals, training in Cornerstones, Leadership, Crop and Livestock Integration, Animal Wellbeing, Provision of seeds (Rice, Vegetables & Groundnut), Veterinary Support, Exchange Visits, Sensitization HIV/AIDs, Water and Sanitation and the Environment, influencing policies, systems and practices

This project will target five villages in the Western Rural district of Sierra Leone—Regent, Morthaim, Baoma, Makomba and Crossing—which are characterized by rapid population growth, a high incidence of communicable diseases, increased pressure on natural resources and physical infrastructure. The project seeks to increase food production, improve household nutrition, generate supplementary income and increase knowledge and skills of beneficiaries in livestock and crop production. A total of 844 farm families—211 original families and 633 who will benefit from the practice of passing on the gift—will receive 714 goats and 132 sheep. The beneficiaries will be encouraged to cultivate a total of 152 acres of rice, groundnut and assorted vegetables. These crops are both cash and food crops and an important source of income, particularly for women. Training in improved livestock husbandry, crop farming practices and crop and livestock integration, drugs and veterinary support services will also be provided. Furthermore, two members will be identified within each group to train as Community Animal Health Workers who will provide veterinary services to the beneficiaries. Heifer Sierra Leone will also work with local communities to build leadership skills and awareness on issues relating to HIV/AIDS, water, sanitation and the environment.
